channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: SGFormer: Single-Layer Graph Transformers with Approximation-Free Linear Complexity
item.description: Learning representations on large graphs is a long-standing challenge due to the inter-dependence nature.

item.title: In-depth Analysis of Low-rank Matrix Factorisation in a Federated Setting
item.description: We provide a linear rate of convergence of the excess loss which depends on $\sigma_{\max} / \sigma_{r}$, where $\sigma_{r}$ is the $r^{\mathrm{th}}$ singular value of the concatenation $\mathbf{S}$ of the matrices $(\mathbf{S}^i)_{i=1}^N$.

item.title: Exploiting Supervised Poison Vulnerability to Strengthen Self-Supervised Defense
item.description: Availability poisons exploit supervised learning (SL) algorithms by introducing class-related shortcut features in images such that models trained on poisoned data are useless for real-world datasets.

item.title: MAPX: An explainable model-agnostic framework for the detection of false information on social media networks
item.description: The automated detection of false information has become a fundamental task in combating the spread of "fake news" on online social media networks (OSMN) as it reduces the need for manual discernment by individuals.

item.title: Uncertainty Estimation by Density Aware Evidential Deep Learning
item.description: Evidential deep learning (EDL) has shown remarkable success in uncertainty estimation.

item.title: Causal Transformer for Fusion and Pose Estimation in Deep Visual Inertial Odometry
item.description: This study aims to improve pose estimation accuracy by leveraging the attention mechanisms in transformers, which better utilize historical data compared to the recurrent neural network (RNN) based methods seen in recent methods.

item.title: Distilling Monolingual and Crosslingual Word-in-Context Representations
item.description: The results on the monolingual tasks confirmed that our representations exhibited a competitive performance compared to that of the previous study for the context-aware lexical semantic tasks and outperformed it for STS estimation.

item.title: Comparative Analysis of Pretrained Audio Representations in Music Recommender Systems
item.description: Over the years, Music Information Retrieval (MIR) has proposed various models pretrained on large amounts of music data.

item.title: Anytime Continual Learning for Open Vocabulary Classification
item.description: We propose a dynamic weighting between predictions of a partially fine-tuned model and a fixed open vocabulary model that enables continual improvement when training samples are available for a subset of a task's labels.

item.title: DiffFAS: Face Anti-Spoofing via Generative Diffusion Models
item.description: Based on our analysis, we propose DiffFAS framework, which quantifies quality as prior information input into the network to counter image quality shift, and performs diffusion-based high-fidelity cross-domain and cross-attack types generation to counter image style shift.

item.title: VAE Explainer: Supplement Learning Variational Autoencoders with Interactive Visualization
item.description: Variational Autoencoders are widespread in Machine Learning, but are typically explained with dense math notation or static code examples.

item.title: Mamba-YOLO-World: Marrying YOLO-World with Mamba for Open-Vocabulary Detection
item.description: Open-vocabulary detection (OVD) aims to detect objects beyond a predefined set of categories.

item.title: PINNfluence: Influence Functions for Physics-Informed Neural Networks
item.description: Recently, physics-informed neural networks (PINNs) have emerged as a flexible and promising application of deep learning to partial differential equations in the physical sciences.

item.title: GenMapping: Unleashing the Potential of Inverse Perspective Mapping for Robust Online HD Map Construction
item.description: The framework is established with a triadic synergy architecture, including principal and dual auxiliary branches.

item.title: Apollo: Band-sequence Modeling for High-Quality Audio Restoration
item.description: Audio restoration has become increasingly significant in modern society, not only due to the demand for high-quality auditory experiences enabled by advanced playback devices, but also because the growing capabilities of generative audio models necessitate high-fidelity audio.

item.title: VistaFormer: Scalable Vision Transformers for Satellite Image Time Series Segmentation
item.description: We introduce VistaFormer, a lightweight Transformer-based model architecture for the semantic segmentation of remote-sensing images.

item.title: Detect Fake with Fake: Leveraging Synthetic Data-driven Representation for Synthetic Image Detection
item.description: Are general-purpose visual representations acquired solely from synthetic data useful for detecting fake images?

item.title: Agents in Software Engineering: Survey, Landscape, and Vision
item.description: In recent years, Large Language Models (LLMs) have achieved remarkable success and have been widely used in various downstream tasks, especially in the tasks of the software engineering (SE) field.

item.title: PiEEG-16 to Measure 16 EEG Channels with Raspberry Pi for Brain-Computer Interfaces and EEG devices
item.description: This article introduces a cost-effective gateway into the fascinating world of neuroscience: the PIEEG-16, a versatile shield for RaspberryPi designed to measure 16 channels of various biosignals, including EEG (electroencephalography), EMG (electromyography), and ECG (electrocardiography) without any data transfer over the network (Wi-Fi, Bluetooth) and processing and feature ectraction directly on the Raspberry in real-time.

item.title: Sign Language Sense Disambiguation
item.description: This project explores methods to enhance sign language translation of German sign language, specifically focusing on disambiguation of homonyms.

item.title: Learning Short Codes for Fading Channels with No or Receiver-Only Channel State Information
item.description: Gaussian codes that achieve capacity for AWGN channels may be unsuitable for these no-CSI and CSIR-only cases.

item.title: Latent Space Score-based Diffusion Model for Probabilistic Multivariate Time Series Imputation
item.description: To address these issues, we propose the Latent Space Score-Based Diffusion Model (LSSDM) for probabilistic multivariate time series imputation.

item.title: Measure-Theoretic Time-Delay Embedding
item.description: The celebrated Takens' embedding theorem provides a theoretical foundation for reconstructing the full state of a dynamical system from partial observations.

item.title: Pushing the boundaries of event subsampling in event-based video classification using CNNs
item.description: Event cameras offer low-power visual sensing capabilities ideal for edge-device applications.

item.title: Integrating Neural Operators with Diffusion Models Improves Spectral Representation in Turbulence Modeling
item.description: We integrate neural operators with diffusion models to address the spectral limitations of neural operators in surrogate modeling of turbulent flows.

item.title: Biomimetic Frontend for Differentiable Audio Processing
item.description: While models in audio and speech processing are becoming deeper and more end-to-end, they as a consequence need expensive training on large data, and are often brittle.

item.title: CasDyF-Net: Image Dehazing via Cascaded Dynamic Filters
item.description: Inspired by dynamic filtering, we propose using cascaded dynamic filters to create a multi-branch network by dynamically generating filter kernels based on feature map distribution.

item.title: When Context Leads but Parametric Memory Follows in Large Language Models
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) have demonstrated remarkable progress in leveraging diverse knowledge sources.

item.title: Shadow Program Inversion with Differentiable Planning: A Framework for Unified Robot Program Parameter and Trajectory Optimization
item.description: This paper presents SPI-DP, a novel first-order optimizer capable of optimizing robot programs with respect to both high-level task objectives and motion-level constraints.

item.title: Optimizing Rare Word Accuracy in Direct Speech Translation with a Retrieval-and-Demonstration Approach
item.description: To leverage these valuable resources, we propose a retrieval-and-demonstration approach to enhance rare word translation accuracy in direct ST models.

item.title: Molecular Graph Representation Learning via Structural Similarity Information
item.description: In particular, we propose a specially designed graph that leverages graph kernel algorithms to represent the similarity between molecules quantitatively.

item.title: CF-PRNet: Coarse-to-Fine Prototype Refining Network for Point Cloud Completion and Reconstruction
item.description: In modern agriculture, precise monitoring of plants and fruits is crucial for tasks such as high-throughput phenotyping and automated harvesting.

item.title: Co-Optimization of Robot Design and Control: Enhancing Performance and Understanding Design Complexity
item.description: This might limit how well the design is adapted to a task, as the suitability of the design is given by how well the robot performs in the task, which requires both a design and a controller.

item.title: B4: Towards Optimal Assessment of Plausible Code Solutions with Plausible Tests
item.description: Our proposed approximated optimal strategy B4 significantly surpasses existing heuristics in selecting code solutions generated by large language models (LLMs) with LLM-generated tests, achieving a relative performance improvement by up to 50% over the strongest heuristic and 246% over the random selection in the most challenging scenarios.

item.title: https://arxiv.org/pdf/2409.07491
item.description: This article introduces a cost-effective gateway into the fascinating world of neuroscience: the PIEEG-16, a versatile shield for RaspberryPi designed to measure 16 channels of various biosignals, including EEG (electroencephalography), EMG (electromyography), and ECG (electrocardiography) without any data transfer over the network (Wi-Fi, Bluetooth) and processing and feature ectraction directly on the Raspberry in real-time.

item.title: SkinFormer: Learning Statistical Texture Representation with Transformer for Skin Lesion Segmentation
item.description: In this paper, we propose a trans\textbf{Former} network (\textbf{SkinFormer}) that efficiently extracts and fuses statistical texture representation for \textbf{Skin} lesion segmentation.

item.title: HTR-VT: Handwritten Text Recognition with Vision Transformer
item.description: To address this limitation, we introduce a data-efficient ViT method that uses only the encoder of the standard transformer.

item.title: Data Efficient Child-Adult Speaker Diarization with Simulated Conversations
item.description: We then train a Whisper Encoder-based model, achieving strong zero-shot performance on child-adult speaker diarization using real datasets.

item.title: Pathfinder for Low-altitude Aircraft with Binary Neural Network
item.description: A prior global topological map (e. g., the OpenStreetMap, OSM) can boost the performance of autonomous mapping by a ground mobile robot.

item.title: Explaining Datasets in Words: Statistical Models with Natural Language Parameters
item.description: To make sense of massive data, we often fit simplified models and then interpret the parameters; for example, we cluster the text embeddings and then interpret the mean parameters of each cluster.

item.title: SynSUM -- Synthetic Benchmark with Structured and Unstructured Medical Records
item.description: The SynSUM dataset is primarily designed to facilitate research on clinical information extraction in the presence of tabular background variables, which can be linked through domain knowledge to concepts of interest to be extracted from the text - the symptoms, in the case of SynSUM.

item.title: Breaking reCAPTCHAv2
item.description: Our work examines the efficacy of employing advanced machine learning methods to solve captchas from Google's reCAPTCHAv2 system.

item.title: Bridging Dynamic Factor Models and Neural Controlled Differential Equations for Nowcasting GDP
item.description: However, DFMs face two main challenges: i) the lack of capturing economic uncertainties such as sudden recessions or booms, and ii) the limitation of capturing irregular dynamics from mixed-frequency data.

item.title: Exploring SSL Discrete Speech Features for Zipformer-based Contextual ASR
item.description: Self-supervised learning (SSL) based discrete speech representations are highly compact and domain adaptable.

item.title: ODAQ: Open Dataset of Audio Quality - Benchmark on GitHub
item.description: ODAQ is a dataset addressing the scarcity of openly available collections of audio signals accompanied by corresponding subjective scores of perceived quality.

item.title: TabKANet: Tabular Data Modelling with Kolmogorov-Arnold Network and Transformer
item.description: Tabular data is the most common type of data in real-life scenarios.

item.title: WirelessAgent: Large Language Model Agents for Intelligent Wireless Networks
item.description: Wireless networks are increasingly facing challenges due to their expanding scale and complexity.

item.title: Domain Adaptation for DoA Estimation in Multipath Channels with Interferences
item.description: We consider the problem of estimating the direction-of-arrival (DoA) of a desired source located in a known region of interest in the presence of interfering sources and multipath.

item.title: Improving Text-guided Object Inpainting with Semantic Pre-inpainting
item.description: In this paper, we propose to decompose the typical single-stage object inpainting into two cascaded processes: 1) semantic pre-inpainting that infers the semantic features of desired objects in a multi-modal feature space; 2) high-fieldity object generation in diffusion latent space that pivots on such inpainted semantic features.

item.title: Enhancing Few-Shot Image Classification through Learnable Multi-Scale Embedding and Attention Mechanisms
item.description: We conducted comprehensive evaluations on the MiniImageNet and FC100 datasets, specifically in the 5-way 1-shot and 5-way 5-shot scenarios.
